Culinary Profile & Uses
1. Flavour and Form

It offers a firm, snappy, almost cartilaginous crunch that is uniquely satisfying. Its flavour is a well-balanced blend of fresh ocean brine with a distinct, sweet finish. The branches are deep red, translucent, and form beautiful, intricate clumps that add visual drama to any dish.

2. The Crunch of the Coast

This seaweed is a textural superstar, essential for specific culinary applications.

  • The Poke Bowl Essential: A non-negotiable ingredient in authentic Hawaiian poke, providing a crucial crunchy contrast to the soft, marinated cubes of raw fish and creamy avocado.
  • Advanced Salads: Shines in seaweed salads, either on its own or mixed with other sea vegetables like sea lettuce. Its robust texture holds up well to bold, citrus-based dressings.
  • Sushi & Seafood Garnish: Used as a bed for sashimi or a garnish for grilled fish, adding both a splash of colour and a burst of oceanic crunch.
3. The Harvest and Yield

The algae grows in dense, bushy clumps on the HydraPad™. Harvesting involves trimming the bushiest branches from the main clump, which encourages further branching. A single pad provides a continuous yield of 40–60g of crisp, ready-to-eat seaweed every 2-3 weeks.
